item.title: CrowdStrike Shares Sink After Sales Forecast Underwhelms
item.description: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. shares fell after the cybersecurity company projected revenue for the current quarter that trailed estimates.
item.dc:creator: Jake Bleiberg

media:content.media:description: Crowdstrike Holdings Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Monday, July 22, 2024. Stocks rebounded after their worst week since April as investors looked beyond Joe Biden ending his reelection campaign to focus on the start of the tech earnings season. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Software Error Forces MIAX Sapphire Exchange to Bust Trades
item.description: Exchange operator Miami International Holdings, Inc. had an operational snafu on Tuesday causing one of its four options exchanges to shut down and forcing transactions to be torn up.
item.dc:creator: Bernard Goyder

media:content.media:description: The downtown skyline in Miami, Florida, US, on Wednesday, July 20, 2022. Ken Griffin's plans to shift Citadel's headquarters to Miami from Chicago gained momentum months ago with a record-breaking acquisition on the South Florida waterfront. Photographer: Eva Marie Uzcategui/Bloomberg

item.title: Nintendo Can’t Afford a Slip Up With Switch 2
item.description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: Can Nintendo continue to thrill gamers with a pricey new console and games to match.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Ng, Yang Yang, K Oanh Ha

media:content.media:description: A person holds of the new Nintendo Switch 2 video-game console system.

item.title: Meta Turns to Nuclear Power to Run AI | Bloomberg Technology 6/3/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Meta’s plans to buy nuclear power from Constellation Energy. Plus xAI is selling $5 billion in debt, the latest in a series of fundraising efforts across Elon Musk’s business empire. And former Tesla executive Drew Baglino talks about his new startup Heron Power, aiming to upend the transformer industry. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: HPE Posts Strong Revenue Growth, Sees Reduced Tariff Impact
item.description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. reported quarterly revenue that topped estimates and said it expects a reduced impact from tariffs on its business this year.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise headquarters in Spring, Texas.

item.title: Robinhood Shares Ride Crypto Boom Back to Record Highs
item.description: Nearly four years after its much-hyped debut, Robinhood Markets Inc. has finally seen its shares hit a fresh record as cryptocurrency markets rally.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin

media:content.media:description: The Robinhood Crypto booth on the exhibition floor during the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, US, on Thursday, May 29, 2025. The event will examine Bitcoin's evolving global impact, with speakers from education, policy, finance, and technology.

item.title: Climate Investor Energize Raises $430 Million for New VC Fund
item.description: The climate tech investment firm Energize Capital has raised $430 million for a new fund targeting early-stage startups working on projects like new batteries and software for the electric grid.
item.dc:creator: Paayal Zaveri

media:content.media:description: Power transmission towers outside the Crimson Battery Energy Storage Project in Blythe, California, US, on Tuesday, Oct. 18, 2022. Axium Infrastructure and Canadian Solar’s subsidiaries of Recurrent Energy and CSI Energy Storage announced the two have installed and activated what they are calling the world’s largest single-phase energy storage facility. Photographer: Bing Guan/Bloomberg

item.title: Ex-Tesla Executive Signs Letter of Intent with Stargate’s Crusoe
item.description: A startup founded by former Tesla Inc. executive Drew Baglino has signed letters of intent to sell technology designed to address one of the artificial intelligence boom’s biggest bottlenecks: aging infrastructure and a transformer shortage.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Ma, Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Drew Baglino, CEO, Heron Power

item.title: Marathon’s Richards Raises Caution on Direct Lending to Software Firms
item.description: Handing out private loans to software technology companies is not “intelligent,” said Marathon Asset Management Chief Executive Officer and founder Bruce Richards.
item.dc:creator: Dorothy Ma, Eliza Ronalds-Hannon

media:content.media:description: Bruce Richards, chief executive officer of Marathon Asset Management LP, during a Bloomberg Television interview in London, UK, on Tuesday, July 16, 2024. Marathon Asset Management and Webster Financial Corp. are forming a private credit joint venture focused on direct lending to private equity-backed middle-market companies, according to a statement.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg’s AI Slop Will Make Ads Creepier and Worse
item.description: As Meta grabs for more control over how companies talk to customers, the rest of us may be left flooded in more algorithmic mediocrity.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: Microsoft Cuts Hundreds of Jobs After Firing 6,000 in May
item.description: Microsoft Corp. cut hundreds more jobs just weeks after its largest layoff in years, underscoring the tech industry’s efforts to trim costs even as it plows billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Signage outside the Microsoft campus in Mountain View, California, US, on Tuesday, Jan 28, 2025. Microsoft Corp. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 29.

item.title: Meta’s Deal for Nuclear Power Is Likely Cheaper Than Microsoft’s, Jefferies Says
item.description: Surging demand for power to run artificial intelligence just prompted Meta Platforms Inc. to enter a 20-year contract with the biggest US nuclear operator, penning a deal that’s likely to be priced at a cheaper rate than a similar agreement rival Microsoft Corp. entered last year.
item.dc:creator: Will Wade, Naureen S Malik

media:content.media:description: The Clinton Power Station in Clinton, Illinois, in 2016.

item.title: Kuwait Wealth Fund Joins Microsoft, MGX’s $30 Billion AI Venture
item.description: Kuwait’s sovereign wealth fund is joining a Microsoft Corp.-backed initiative to bankroll $30 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure globally, as the oil-rich Gulf nation looks to tap into the booming sector.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

media:content.media:description: The Kuwait investment Authority headquarters in Kuwait City.

item.title: Broadcom Ships New Gear Meant to Improve AI Chip Performance
item.description: Data center switch will let customers get more from their Nvidia processors
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: An Nvidia Corp. GB300 NVL72 GPU on display at the Foxconn Technology Co. booth during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. Computex kicked off Monday in Taipei, and as in years past will draw industry chieftains from Huang and Qualcomm Inc.'s Cristiano Amon to Young Liu of Foxconn, which makes the bulk of the world's iPhones and Nvidia servers.

item.title: Chinese EV Maker Nio to Reduce R&D Costs to Hit Break-Even Goal
item.description: Nio Inc. aims to reduce research and development spending by as much as 25% as it seeks to reach its break-even target by the fourth quarter.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo

media:content.media:description: Nio Inc. electric vehicles move through a production line at the company's factory in Hefei, China.

item.title: Musk’s X Aims to Soothe EU Regulators With Blue Check Disclaimer
item.description: Elon Musk’s social network X is showing users a prominent disclaimer about the platform’s blue checkmark program in a bid to appease concerns from the European Union’s content regulators that it’s deceptive and should be overhauled.
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli, Samuel Stolton

item.title: Meta to Buy Nuclear Power From Constellation as AI Demand Soars
item.description: Constellation Energy Corp. agreed to sell power from an Illinois nuclear plant to Meta Platforms Inc. as artificial intelligence sends power demand soaring.
item.dc:creator: Will Wade, Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: The Clinton Power Station in Clinton, Illinois, in 2016. Photographer: John Dixon/The News-Gazette/AP

item.title: Victoria’s Secret Says Security Incident That Shut Down Website May Hurt Results
item.description: Victoria’s Secret & Co. said a security incident that caused it to shut down its e-commerce site may hurt results for the current quarter.
item.dc:creator: Lily Meier

media:content.media:description: A Victoria's Secret store in San Francisco.

item.title: TSMC Flags Delays in Japan Expansion While US Plans Advance
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Chief Executive Officer C. C. Wei blamed worsening traffic snarls for delays in expanding its base in southwestern Japan, even while a parallel US effort races ahead.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: C. C. Wei at the meeting in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Photographer: An Rong Xu/Bloomberg

item.title: Prosus President and Chief Investment Officer Tu to Resign
item.description: Prosus NV’s President and Chief Investment Officer Ervin Tu will step down from his role after a nearly four-year tenure during which the South African-Dutch tech investment company restructured itself and appointed a new chief executive officer.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

item.title: Cracking the Code of Making Old Clothes New Again
item.description: Discarded clothing is an environmental scourge. But across Europe, companies are joining forces to build new technologies that could make recycling scalable.
item.dc:creator: Paul Tullis

media:content.media:description: Discarded clothing has become a global environmental problem, but in Europe and elsewhere, new methods of recycling may present a solution. Above, post-consumer textile bales ready for recycling at Brightfiber in Amsterdam.

item.title: Huawei’s Pura X Is An Intriguing New Foldable — If You’re Outside the US
item.description: Review: The clamshell device is the company’s first flagship phone to launch with its new operating system to challenge iOS and Android.

media:content.media:description: Huawei Pura X Photographer: Zhongjia Sun/Bloomberg

item.title: Former Key SpaceX Engineer’s Impulse Space Raises $300 Million
item.description: Impulse Space raised $300 million in its latest funding round as the US-based startup looks to cash in on demand for its highly agile spacecraft.
item.dc:creator: Sana Pashankar

media:content.media:description: A rendering of Impulse Space's Mira OTV carrying satellite deployers made by Exolaunch.

item.title: Ex-Lebanese PM Sets Up Abu Dhabi Investment Firm Targeting AI
item.description: Former Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Hariri is launching an investment firm in Abu Dhabi, deepening his ties to the capital of the United Arab Emirates.
item.dc:creator: Ben Bartenstein

media:content.media:description: Saad Hariri in 2019.

item.title: China’s Manus Shows the Promise of AI Agents: Review
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Newley Purnell tests out the Manus AI agent.
item.dc:creator: Newley Purnell

media:content.media:description: The Manus AI agent from Beijing-based Butterfly Effect. Photographer: Justin Chin/Bloomberg

item.title: AI Drug Startup Touts Promising Advance in Treating Lung Disease
item.description: A drug developed using artificial intelligence showed signs of efficacy in treating an incurable lung disease in what its developer calls a clinical first.
item.dc:creator: Amber Tong

media:content.media:description: Alex Zhavoronkov at Insilico Medicine's research facility in Suzhou, China. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: Xiaomi Founder Expects EV Arm to Turn Profitable After New SUV
item.description: Xiaomi Corp. founder Lei Jun expects its year-old EV business to turn profitable in the second half, a milestone for the billionaire’s $10 billion endeavor in a cut-throat market.
item.dc:creator: Yuan Gao, Jessica Sui, Linda Lew

media:content.media:description: A Xiaomi Corp. SU7 electric vehicle on display at a store in Shanghai.

item.title: AI Pioneer Launches Research Group to Help Build Safer Agents
item.description: Yoshua Bengio, an artificial intelligence pioneer, is creating a new nonprofit research organization to promote an alternative approach to developing cutting-edge AI systems, with the aim of mitigating the technology’s potential risks. The nonprofit, called LawZero, is set to launch Tuesday with $30 million in backing from one of former Google Chief Executive Officer Eric Schmidt’s philanthropic organizations and Skype co-founder Jaan Tallinn, among others. Bengio will lead a team of more than 1
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Yoshua Bengio, founder and scientific director of Mila at the Quebec AI Institute, during the All In event in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, on Wednesday, Sept. 27, 2023. The event aims to connect people to real-life applications of Canadian AI in business, research and ethical pursuits.

item.title: Philippine Fintech GCash to Split Stocks Ahead of Possible IPO
item.description: The company behind the Philippines’ top mobile wallet GCash has approved a stock split to increase the number of its common shares amid plans for an initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Neil Jerome Morales, Cliff Harvey Venzon

media:content.media:description: A customer adds credit to his mobile phone by using a Globe Telecom Inc. GCash top-up machine in Taguig city, Metro Manila, the Philippines, on Monday, Oct. 23, 2017. Globe is tapping its partnership with Chinese Billionaire Jack Ma’s Ant Financial for capital, expertise and technology, Cu said in an interview. Photographer: Veejay Villafranca/Bloomberg

item.title: Tom Cruise’s ‘Mission Impossible’ Tops China Box Office
item.description: Tom Cruise’s film is back on top in China. Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning posted the biggest opening for a US film in the country this year, defying trade and geopolitical tensions between Washington and Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Sohee Kim

media:content.media:description: Tom Cruise in London for the Global Premiere of Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning on May 15.
